thread.title: Ellen Pompeo Blasts Daniel Craig Over James Bond Suicide Remarks
thread.title_full: Ellen Pompeo Blasts Daniel Craig Over James Bond Suicide Remarks

author: AceShowbiz.com
title: Ellen Pompeo Blasts Daniel Craig Over James Bond Suicide Remarks
text:
Comments The 'Spectre' actor previously said he would rather slash his wrists rather than reprising his role as agent 007. 
Ellen Pompeo took to Twitter on Thursday, October 8 to respond to Daniel Craig 's recent comments insinuating that he would rather kill himself than return for another James Bond movie. Ellen retweeted a link to Daniel's interview and wrote, "This dude needs a reality check." A follower later commented on Ellen's tweet, "@EllenPompeo @JustJared there is a good chance that's not exactly what he said, the media can embellish things." The " Grey's Anatomy " star then replied, "You are absolutely right! I certainly have been there." Another follower wrote, "@EllenPompeo but true fans (and reasonable people) know that the media tends to blow up everything and twist it to get a good headline," to which the "Daredevil" actress replied, "Yes they do #smart girl!" In an interview with TimeOut, Daniel was asked whether he would reprise his role as James Bond after " Spectre ". The actor replied , "I'd rather break this glass and slash my wrists. No, not at the moment. Not at all. That's fine. I'm over it at the moment. We're done. All I want to do is move on." When asked if he wanted to move on from "Bond" for good, Daniel said, "I haven't given it any thought. For at least a year or two, I just don't want to think about it. I don't know what the next step is. I've no idea. Not because I'm trying to be cagey. Who the f**k knows? At the moment, we've done it. I'm not in discussion with anybody about anything. If I did another Bond movie, it would only be for the money."
